texts.definition: Forced sharing of rewards between players.
markups: One part of the gameplay in most games is receiving rewards. When a reward needs to be split between more than one player, that reward becomes a <style="CurrentLink">Shared Reward</style>.

Winning is a <style="CurrentLink">Shared Reward</style> in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Co-Op%20Games">Co-Op Games</link></style> such as <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Dead%20of%20Winter">Dead of Winter</link></style>, the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Left%204%20Dead%20series">Left 4 Dead series</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Space%20Alert">Space Alert</link></style>. Groups of player characters in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Roleplaying%20Games">Roleplaying Games</link></style> such as <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Dungeons%20&%20Dragons">Dungeons & Dragons</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/GURPS">GURPS</link></style> often together defeat enemies, and then together need to share the rewards given for doing so.  <style="CurrentLink">Shared Rewards</style> can be said to be given to groups exploring instances in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/World%20of%20Warcraft">World of Warcraft</link></style> since they have to divide loot they receive, and only those in an instance can receive parts.

In <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Carcassonne">Carcassonne</link></style> one possible way to gain points is to finish building a town but all players that have the same claim to the town receive the same amount of points.

If not already preset through the use of <style="Link"><link="teams">Teams</link></style>, etc., <style="CurrentLink">Shared Rewards</style> can be designed around <style="Link"><link="collaborative-actions">Collaborative Actions</link></style> or the effects that apply to <style="Link"><link="factions">Factions</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Social%20Organizations">Social Organizations</link></style>. They can also be designed to be a consequence of <style="Link"><link="tied-results">Tied Results</link></style>. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Negotiation">Negotiation</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Player-Decided%20Distributions">Player-Decided Distributions</link></style> can be used to let players have a say in how the <style="Link"><link="rewards">Rewards</link></style> are distributed, and making the <style="Link"><link="rewards">Rewards</link></style> into <style="Link"><link="shared-resources">Shared Resources</link></style> can postpone such discussions until latter.

Several patterns work against players having <style="CurrentLink">Shared Rewards</style>. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Conflicts">Conflicts</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="excluding-goals">Excluding Goals</link></style> among those with the <style="CurrentLink">Shared Rewards</style> may interfere with their <style="Link"><link="cooperation">Cooperation</link></style> or wish to share <style="Link"><link="rewards">Rewards</link></style> with the others. <style="Link"><link="individual-rewards">Individual Rewards</link></style> are of course incompatible with <style="CurrentLink">Shared Rewards</style> concerning the same <style="Link"><link="rewards">Reward</link></style> but the availability of <style="Link"><link="individual-rewards">Individual Rewards</link></style> can also lessen the wish to strive for <style="CurrentLink">Shared Rewards</style>. Some <style="Link"><link="altruistic-actions">Altruistic Actions</link></style> may somewhat surprisingly work against <style="CurrentLink">Shared Rewards</style> since they can allow for players for forsake their part of the <style="Link"><link="rewards">Rewards</link></style>. <style="Link"><link="tiebreakers">Tiebreakers</link></style> can be used to modify games that otherwise would allow <style="CurrentLink">Shared Rewards</style> for <style="Link"><link="tied-results">Tied Results</link></style>.

<style="CurrentLink">Shared Rewards</style> work against the presence of <style="Link"><link="delayed-reciprocity">Delayed Reciprocity</link></style> since it either makes <style="Link"><link="rewards">Rewards</link></style> be shared at once or have distributions set out in advance.

Having <style="CurrentLink">Shared Rewards</style> can form <style="Link"><link="mutual-goals">Mutual Goals</link></style> between players, and is likely to cause <style="Link"><link="cooperation">Cooperation</link></style> between them. It can also be the basis for <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Uncommitted%20Alliances">Uncommitted Alliances</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="teams">Teams</link></style>. <style="CurrentLink">Shared Rewards</style> can make both <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Alliances">Alliances</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Competition">Competition</link></style> stronger, in the latter case by setting up the "problem" of having to share <style="Link"><link="rewards">Rewards</link></style> as a threat. They modify how players can claim <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Ownership">Ownership</link></style> of the <style="Link"><link="rewards">Rewards</link></style> and can become focus for possible <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Social%20Interaction">Social Interaction</link></style> between them.

As <style="Link"><link="rewards">Rewards</link></style> given to several different players, <style="CurrentLink">Shared Rewards</style> can serve to create a sense of <style="Link"><link="togetherness">Togetherness</link></style> between them. This can also have <style="Link"><link="balancing-effects">Balancing Effects</link></style> if the distribution by the system or players give the best <style="Link"><link="rewards">Rewards</link></style> to the weakest players. However, if the <style="Link"><link="rewards">Rewards</link></style> are not easy to split evenly, they may cause <style="Link"><link="social-dilemmas">Social Dilemmas</link></style> and some players may need to take on <style="Link"><link="social-roles">Social Roles</link></style> handling this. This become most apparent when <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Uncommitted%20Alliances">Uncommitted Alliances</link></style> are given <style="CurrentLink">Shared Rewards</style> due to <style="Link"><link="tied-results">Tied Results</link></style> as the <style="Link"><link="rewards">Rewards</link></style> then become <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Player-Decided%20Distributions">Player-Decided Distributions</link></style>.
